author: blogs.wsj.com
title: Varsity Math Week 141
text:
0 COMMENTS Photo: Luci Gutierrez
The coach decides it’s time for the team to get some more numerical exercise.
Sudoku Variant
Place numbers in the grid so that each row and each column contain the numbers 1 through 5 and the sums of numbers in the outlined regions are all different.
Photo: National Museum of Mathematics
Making 8 and 16
Produce math expressions in which you may use only +, -, ×, ÷, exponents, decimal points and parentheses.
a. Make 8 using 4, 7 and 8 (each number only once).
b. Make 16 using 2, 4 and 7 (each number only once).
See answers to last week’s puzzles below.
Come back next week for answers and more puzzles.
Note: Comments may include spoilers.
The National Museum of Mathematics (MoMath) is North America’s only museum devoted to mathematics. Learn more at momath.org .
****
Answers
In Nick’s Birthday , Nick is born on Jan. 2 and made the statement on Dec. 31. For Burning Ropes , simultaneously light the first rope from one end and the second rope from both ends. When the second rope is consumed, the first will have e – √2/2 hours to go. Light the other end of the first rope at this instant to produce a time of e/2 – √2/4 = 1.0055875… hours when the first rope is consumed.
